li.a: Why this approach?
li.div:
The Employee Participative Innovation programme is 1 goal, 2 action levers and 3 objectives:
1 GOAL:
Eureka lets each of us participate in the Group’s development by proposing innovative ideas, some of which will be selected for implementation.
Each division or subsidiary will regularly ask you to consider a specific question, alone or in a group. These are the challenges.
By giving all employees the ability to meet the Group’s challenges, the entire company moves PagesJaunes forward and builds it future!
2 ACTION LEVERS:
Organise a real network process with shared ideas, know-how and experiences.
Develop an information feedback system that makes it easy for everyone to contribute through Eureka, an idea posting and sharing platform open to everyone.
3 OBJECTIVES:
Stimulate all employees’ initiative and creativity to submit ideas that respond to the company’s stakes (improve processes, develop new business, customer/user satisfaction, etc.)
Recognise and reward the best ideas.
Transform the ideas into tangible results.

li.a: What do we expect from the programme?

div.p: With the programme we expect all employees to get involved, irrespective of their subsidiary, to develop innovation in the Group with regard to our organisation, processes, services, products, etc. And even more interaction between all Group teams, with the implementation of an innovation culture in the background.

li.a: What is a challenge?

div.p: Eureka will be punctuated throughout the year by the challenges the various Divisions and subsidiaries will submit to you.

A Challenge is a call for ideas on a specific key subject, during a defined lapse of time. This subject can concern the entire PagesJaunes Group or be dedicated to a specific issue encountered by one or more services/entities.
At the end of the challenge, rewards will be given to the challenge’s best ideas. The authors and winning and short-listed ideas will be highlighted and exploited.

li.a: Ideas, but about what? What is a good idea?

div.p: The different Divisions and subsidiaries will regularly send me challenges covering key questions. The Group is counting on us to get mobilised and respond to its stakes.
The ideas posted on Eureka should serve:
The Group’s stakes: customer satisfaction, improve our processes/organisation, develop new user services…
And/or the company’s core businesses: technical, commercial, communication, processes or even our daily organisation, to cite but these.
Criteria that can guide you include:

ol.li: NEWNESS: the idea is new: compared to the existing processes/products/services in the Group or in the market
FEASIBILITY: the idea is accompanied by an implementation deliberation / recommendation. Its use / application in the Group should provide well-argued results.

IMPACT: my idea’s implementation should provide corporate-wide or team-wide progress (idea of proximity). This improvement would be real and measurable (efficiency, savings, quality, image, productivity gains, customer satisfaction, new products, new services, etc.).

div.p: A good idea is not necessarily a big invention: it can involve a way of simplifying procedures to resolve a recurrent problem, avoid expenditures or investments, adapt a good practice seen elsewhere, etc.
Remember that ideas and comments must be posted in a spirit of building and improving, but also respecting others and legality.

li.a: What isn't a good idea?

ul.li: A declaration of a utopian intention such as “all we need to do” that isn’t accompanied by a consideration of how to implement it: “e.g. buy Google”
A report of a malfunction that isn’t accompanied by a constructive proposal: “e.g.; the coffee machine always breaks down”
A purchase need or disguised capital expenditure request: “e.g.; the sales reps would be must more efficient with 2 Blackberries, an unlimited call plan and an ultra light portable computer”

li.a: What path does an idea follow?
How are the best contributors acknowledged?

p.strong: Each time I make a contribution on EUREKA, I earn and accumulate points.

div.p: My counter turns when I submit an idea, comment on an idea, vote, answer a survey or accept a challenge, based on a predefined scale.

tr.td: First idea published on a Challenge

div.p: When an idea is posted collectively, the points will be shared equally between the co-authors, rounded to the nearest higher point (e.g. I post an idea with 3 co-authors, we each will receive 4 points when the idea is published).

li.a: What do the ranks correspond to?

div.p: Depending on my contribution, I accumulate points (see question 7) and therefore I rise in rank. There are 5 ranks:

p.em: * : This scale may be modified based on the programme’s development.

div.p: You can find your rank in your title block:
Or in your profile.

li.a: How can I track and convert my points?

div.p: My available points and earned points can be viewed in My Profile.
My available points correspond to the points that I haven’t converted into gifts yet.
My earned points correspond to the points that I have accumulated since my first connection.
When my credit of available points reaches 500 points, I will be able to convert them into gifts twice during the year: in July/August and in December/January.
For reasons of gift request and distribution efficiency, no request will be considered outside of these 2 periods.
In case of a long absence (sick leave, maternity leave, training, etc.), my points remain earned.

In the case of leaving the Group, the employee can claim the balance of available points before leaving. Gifts will be delivered in July/August or December/January, based on the distribution calendar.

li.a: Who is my Facilitator? What is his role?

div.p: My Innovation Facilitator’s name can be viewed in “My Profile.” He is my special contact to give me information about the programme and to organise Participative Innovation in my entity (my division or my subsidiary).

The Facilitator will receive my idea first. If needed, before publishing it on the site, he may ask me to enrich it to make it stand out more. Once published, he will send the idea to the Idea developer corresponding to the idea’s theme. He will be responsible for assessing the idea.

li.a: What is the role of the Expert?

div.p: Idea developers will be appointed for each challenge launched. Depending on the theme my idea is classified in, it will be sent by my Innovation Facilitator to an Expert with the necessary core business skills to assess it and pre-select it, if it presents a real step forward for the Group.
In his assessment work, he can rely on comments from the community of employees and on internal expertise.
He will assess the potential of my idea, the entity it could be implemented in and the necessary means to implement it.
He will then send a pre-selection of the best ideas to the sponsoring Directors of the challenges.
He will keep me informed of his decision by email.

li.a: What is the role of Managers?

div.p: Managers, by fostering an open and creative state of mind in their team, are genuine promoters of change. By involving us in this Participative Innovation programme, they lead us to be participants in the Group’s transformation.
The Idea developers can call on them to provide their open mind and expertise on an idea during the assessment phase.
And of course, they will promote the employees and ideas in their team.

li.a: How can a Eureka challenge sponsored by my management or my subsidiary be launched?

div.p: If I have a good challenge idea that my entity (Division or subsidiary) could send to all Group employees, I can submit it to the director of my entity.
Indeed, challenges are effectively launched at the initiative of entity directors who want to call on all Group employees with regard to key questions that present a direct stake for the entity.

The DRH/IPS team will then get involved to help the Division or Subsidiary plan the Challenge’s launch, gather the names of Idea developers and the selection jury and implement the communication and organisation.
For any question about launching challenges, contact achaintron@pagesjaunes.fr or candriamadison@pagesjaunes.fr

li.a: A few preconceived notions to refute ... with a smile :-)

div.p:
“That’s more work, I’m swamped…”
Having ideas is part of everyday life. Thanks to EUREKA, I know where and how to share my ideas with all Group employees. Everyone is invited to comment on them so a process becomes second nature! It only takes a few minutes to post an idea on EUREKA. The tool has been designed to use easily and quickly. And the Employee Participative Innovation team will listen to me in order to improve its use. Consequently I don’t hesitate to send in my suggestions.

“Innovation especially concerns marketing and the Internet”
Improving one’s work methods, simplifying procedures, etc. improves efficiency and also comprises innovation. A “small” idea can become a “big” value for employees and the company if managers, experts and colleagues help enrich it. Together, we are stronger!

“There are procedures that are made to be applied”
Exactly! However, the ideas provided by our employees are key to continuously improving our work methods and customer satisfaction. The guidelines can’t take into account all of the realities of implementation in the field: the ideas can help improve them while respecting them.

li.a: How can I submit an idea?
li.div:
I click on the “Submit an idea” button in the centre of the homepage.
I fill in the mandatory fields (identified by an asterisk).
In the Title field: I summarise my idea in a few words.
In the Challenge field: I select the challenge I want to participate in. By default, the selection is on the current challenge. Comment: if it is a spontaneous idea that doesn’t correspond to a challenge, I select “None.”
In the Description field: I describe my proposal and how my idea will provide progress, an improvement or a new feature for the Group or an entity. I describe the means or solutions that I recommend to implement this idea.
I can Hide my name, so my Innovation Facilitator can’t see it. Caution, once my Innovation Facilitator has published my idea on the EUREKA site, all employees will be able to see my identity!
To promote my idea, I can fill in the optional fields. In the Origin field: I describe how I got the idea (e.g.; I noticed a recurrent problem that can be easily resolved or I discovered a new service/product offered by a competitor; a practice implemented in another company, etc.).
In the Impact field: I describe the benefit that implementing my idea could provide (e.g.; time savings, improved brand image, additional revenue generated by a new product, etc.).
In the Keywords field: I enter a few keywords that can make it easier for other employees to understand my idea.
Once the fields are filled in, I can Submit the idea.
My idea will be sent to my Innovation Facilitator who, if needed, can ask me to enrich it before it is published on the EUREKA site. He will then send it to the Idea developer responsible for assessing it (based on the idea’s theme). If I haven’t finished filling in the form, I can Save it as a Draft, and finish it later.

li.a: How can I revise or complete my idea later?
li.div:
If I haven’t finished filling in the form, I can Save it as a Draft, and finish it later.
My idea is automatically placed in the “My ideas” tab. To return to it, I click on the “My ideas” tab and then on the link “ideas in Draft state.” By clicking on the “Edit” button, I can complete or modify my form. Then I can “Submit” it to send it to my Innovation Facilitator.

li.a: How can I search for an idea in EUREKA?
li.div:
I have 3 possibilities:
by clicking on a keyword in the Tags cloud at the bottom of the page, in the right block on the homepage,
by clicking on a keyword in the search engine at the top right of the screen,
by clicking on a theme on the homepage, in the right block

li.a: How can I stay informed of news on the EUREKA site?

ul.li: I can consult the latest ideas published on the homepage
I can consult the most popular ideas in the “The most voted” tab
I can consult the “most commented on” ideas in the tab of the same name
I can consult the latest news (in the block in the lower left)

li.a: How can I consult or modify my profile?
li.div:
My profile is visible to the community of Group employees. The information is optional and declarative. I can complete my personal information (telephone number, my skills, my expertises, my hobbies, etc.) to make it easier to connect with other Group employees.
I can validate my changes by clicking on the “Validate the profile” button.
But I can also consult my number of accumulated points, my status in EUREKA, the ideas I have already submitted and the name of my Innovation Facilitator.
It is friendlier with my photo! I can search for a photo that I want to download by clicking on “Browse” and then “Submit the profile.” Pay attention nevertheless to rights, if I decide to post an image online that doesn’t belong to me.

li.a: How can I be informed of my ideas' treatment?

ul.li: I will receive a notification by email each time my idea clears a step (e.g.; idea published by my Innovation Facilitator, idea being assessed by an Idea developer, etc.).
I can also find all of the ideas I have saved and posted in the “My ideas” tab.

li.a: What should I do if my Facilitator sends me an idea to complete it?
li.div:
In the email sent by my Innovation Facilitator, I can click on the link and go directly to the idea to complete.
I can also go directly to the “My ideas” tab, where I will find a list of ideas to complete or modify under “idea in state of: Normalisation by author.”
By clicking on the “Edit the idea” button, I can complete or modify my idea.
Then I can click on the “Submit” button to send the idea to my Innovation Facilitator.
Small tip: I fill in the form as completely as possible to highlight my idea.

li.a: How can I delete a comment?
li.div:
At any time I can delete any comment I have left by clicking on the “X” icon at the top of each of my comments.
At any time I can report an abuse in a comment.
By clicking on the “!” icon at the top of the comment, the text will be automatically rendered invisible for other employees. The IPS team will be informed and will analyse this comment.

li.a: How can I propose an idea to improve use of the EUREKA site?
li.div: The IPS team wants to involve me in co-constructing the EUREKA site and in designing the Group’s Employee Participative Innovation programme. I don’t hesitate to send it my suggestions for improvement by filling in the form:

li.a: My question isn't shown in this list
li.div:
I contact my Innovation Facilitator, whose assignment includes coordinating my entity by providing advice and a sympathetic ear.
Otherwise, I can also fill in the contact form and send it to the IPS (Employee Participative Innovation) team.
